org.matrix.olm

Class OlmSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.olm.CommonSerializeUtils
      • org.matrix.olm.OlmSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class OlmSession
extends CommonSerializeUtils
implements java.io.Serializable
    Session class used to create Olm sessions in conjunction with OlmAccount class.
    Olm session is used to encrypt data between devices, especially to create Olm group sessions (see OlmOutboundGroupSession and OlmInboundGroupSession).
    To establish an Olm session with Bob, Alice calls initOutboundSession(OlmAccount, String, String) with Bob's identity and onetime keys. Then Alice generates an encrypted PRE_KEY message (encryptMessage(String)) used by Bob to open the Olm session in his side with initOutboundSession(OlmAccount, String, String). From this step on, messages can be exchanged by using encryptMessage(String) and decryptMessage(OlmMessage).

    Detailed implementation guide is available at Implementing End-to-End Encryption in Matrix clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • releaseSessionJni

        private void releaseSessionJni()
        Destroy the corresponding OLM session native object.
        This method must ALWAYS be called when this JAVA instance is destroyed (ie. garbage collected) to prevent memory leak in native side. See createNewSessionJni().

      • releaseSession

        public void releaseSession()
        Release native session and invalid its JAVA reference counter part.

                         throws OlmException

        aTheirIdentityKey - the identity key of the recipient
        aTheirOneTimeKey - the one time key of the recipient

      • serialize

        protected byte[] serialize(byte[] aKey,
                           java.lang.StringBuffer aErrorMsg)
        Return a session as a bytes buffer.
        The account is serialized and encrypted with aKey. In case of failure, an error human readable description is provide in aErrorMsg.
        Specified by:
        serialize in class CommonSerializeUtils
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        aErrorMsg - error message description
        Returns:
        session as a bytes buffer

      • serializeJni

        Serialize and encrypt session instance.
        An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        aKeyBuffer - key used to encrypt the serialized account data
        Returns:
        the serialised account as bytes buffer.
